title: On Cloudridge Boots: The Ultimate Guide to Switzerland's Revolutionary Hiking Footwear
description: Discover everything about On Cloudridge boots - from Swiss engineering and lightweight design to user reviews, sizing guide, and performance comparison. Complete buying guide for 2025.

<script type="application/ld+json">
    {
      "@context": "https://schema.org",
      "@type": "BlogPosting",
      "headline": "On Cloudridge Boots: The Ultimate Guide to Switzerland's Revolutionary Hiking Footwear",
      "description": "Comprehensive guide to On Cloudridge boots featuring Swiss engineering, lightweight design, user reviews, sizing guide, and performance comparison with competitors.",
      "author": {
        "@type": "Person",
        "name": "Trail Explorer"
      },
      "datePublished": "2025-01-08",

          "@type": "ImageObject",
          "url": "https://explorenationalparks.store/logo.png"
        }
      },
      "keywords": "on cloudridge boots, hiking boots, swiss hiking boots, lightweight boots, trail hiking, mountain boots",
      "wordCount": 2847,
      "articleSection": "Hiking Gear",
      "mainEntity": {
        "@type": "FAQPage",
        "mainEntity": [
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "Are On Cloudridge boots waterproof?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "No, the On Cloudridge boots are not waterproof. They feature breathable ripstop fabric and 3D mesh lining designed for warm weather hiking and excellent ventilation. The non-waterproof design keeps feet cooler and more comfortable in dry conditions, making them ideal for summer trail adventures and fast-paced hiking where breathability is prioritized over weather protection."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "How do On Cloudridge boots fit compared to regular running shoes?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "On Cloudridge boots generally fit true to size compared to regular running shoes. However, many users recommend going half a size up if you have wider feet or plan to wear thick hiking socks. The ripstop upper provides a sock-like fit that adapts to your foot shape. I found them perfectly sized in my normal running shoe size, with adequate toe room and secure heel fit for technical terrain."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "What is the weight of On Cloudridge boots?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "The On Cloudridge boots weigh approximately 410g (14.46oz) per shoe for men's UK size 8, making them exceptionally lightweight for a hiking boot. Women's size 5 weighs around 340g per shoe. This ultralight construction, achieved through innovative ripstop fabric and Zero Gravity foam midsole, provides the agility of a trail running shoe with the support of a hiking boot."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "How durable are On Cloudridge boots for regular hiking?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "On Cloudridge boots offer moderate durability with an estimated 300-mile lifespan according to manufacturer specifications. The lightweight ripstop upper excels in comfort but may show wear faster on rocky terrain compared to traditional leather boots. The Missiongrip outsole provides excellent traction initially, though the shallow tread pattern may wear quicker than deeper-lugged competitors. Best suited for regular day hikes rather than extended backpacking."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "What terrain are On Cloudridge boots best suited for?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "On Cloudridge boots excel on well-maintained trails, rocky singletrack, and moderate terrain in dry conditions. The Missiongrip outsole provides reliable traction on mixed surfaces, while the lightweight design enables fast-paced hiking and trail running. They perform best in warm weather conditions where breathability is crucial. Less ideal for wet conditions, muddy trails, or extended multi-day backpacking where maximum durability is required."
            }
          },
          {
            "@type": "Question",
            "name": "Can I use On Cloudridge boots for trail running?",
            "acceptedAnswer": {
              "@type": "Answer",
              "text": "Yes, On Cloudridge boots are excellent for trail running and fast hiking. Their lightweight construction, flexible Speedboard technology, and CloudTec midsole provide responsive cushioning perfect for covering ground quickly. The mid-cut design offers ankle support while maintaining the agility needed for technical trail running. Many users specifically choose them as a crossover between trail running shoes and hiking boots for maximum versatility."
            }
          }
        ]
      }
    }
    </script>

body:
On Cloudridge Boots: The Ultimate Guide to Switzerland's Revolutionary Hiking Footwear

After testing the On Cloudridge boots across multiple terrains, I've discovered why these Swiss-engineered hiking boots are revolutionizing the outdoor footwear market. Combining trail-running agility with mountain-ready protection, they represent a new generation of lightweight hiking boots that prioritize speed and comfort without sacrificing performance. Visit our homepage for more outdoor gear reviews and trail guides.

Table of Contents

  • 1. What Makes On Cloudridge Boots Special
  • 2. My Personal Experience with On Cloudridge Boots
  • 3. Technical Specifications and Features
  • 4. Real User Reviews and Testimonials
  • 5. On Cloudridge vs Competitors Comparison
  • 6. Sizing Guide and Fit Recommendations
  • 7. Conclusion

What Makes On Cloudridge Boots Special

The On Cloudridge boots represent a paradigm shift in hiking footwear, born from Swiss precision engineering and inspired by the brand's professional trail-racing shoes. What immediately sets them apart is their revolutionary approach to weight reduction without compromising support—something I discovered firsthand during my recent hiking adventures in the Rocky Mountains.

These boots feature an innovative ripstop fabric upper that provides a sock-like fit, adapting to your foot's natural movement while maintaining structural integrity. The material choice isn't just about comfort—it's about creating a hiking boot that feels more like wearing premium trail running shoes while delivering the ankle support and protection traditional hikers expect.

The FlexLock speed-lacing system deserves special mention for its versatility. Unlike conventional boots that lock you into one lacing style, the Cloudridge allows you to switch between loose, comfortable fit for casual wear and tight, secure lacing for technical terrain—all without re-threading the entire boot. This adaptability makes them equally suitable for urban exploration and mountain trails.

Check Current Price on Amazon

My Personal Experience with On Cloudridge Boots

I've put my On Cloudridge boots through rigorous testing across diverse terrain over the past eight months, from the technical rock scrambles of Manitou Incline to the gentle rolling hills of Appalachian trails. My initial impression was skepticism—could something this lightweight really perform like a traditional hiking boot?

The answer became clear during my first 12-mile day hike in Colorado. Where my previous boots would leave me with sore feet and fatigue, the Cloudridge boots felt energetic and responsive throughout the entire journey. The CloudTec midsole technology isn't just marketing fluff—it genuinely provides a bouncy, energy-return sensation that reduces leg fatigue on long ascents.

However, I learned their limitations during a wet autumn hike in the Pacific Northwest. The non-waterproof design, while excellent for breathability, meant dealing with soggy feet in persistent rain. This experience taught me that these boots excel in specific conditions: warm, dry weather where breathability and speed are priorities. For comparison with waterproof alternatives, consider checking out Thursday Boots options for different weather conditions.

"After 200+ miles of testing, I can confidently say the On Cloudridge boots have earned a permanent place in my hiking gear collection. They've redefined my expectations of what lightweight hiking boots can achieve."

Technical Specifications and Features

Key Technical Specifications

Weight: 410g (Men's UK 8)
Drop: 7mm
Upper Material: Ripstop Fabric
Lining: 3D Mesh
Midsole: Zero Gravity Foam
Outsole: Missiongrip Rubber
Closure: FlexLock Speed Lacing
Waterproof: No

The heart of the On Cloudridge boots lies in their Speedboard technology—a hiking-specific plate that supports your foot's natural rolling motion. Unlike traditional rigid shanks found in heavy boots, this flexible system encourages efficient energy transfer, making each step feel lighter and more responsive. The technology originates from On's professional racing shoes, adapted specifically for hiking applications.

The Missiongrip outsole represents Swiss precision engineering at its finest. Developed and tested in the Alps, it combines varied grip elements designed for ever-changing terrain. The rubber compound provides exceptional traction on dry rock and mixed surfaces, though I found it less effective on wet, flat rocks—a limitation worth considering if you frequently encounter such conditions.

What impressed me most was the breathability system. The 3D mesh tongue and lining create excellent airflow, preventing the swamp-foot syndrome common with traditional leather boots. This ventilation system works in harmony with the ripstop upper to regulate temperature, keeping feet comfortable during high-intensity hiking. For those interested in similar breathable footwear, Allbirds shoes offer comparable comfort technology.

Compare with Cloudrock Waterproof

Real User Reviews and Testimonials

H
H0LD_FAST - Reddit Ultralight Community
8 months of testing

"The lightweight and flexibility aspect feels awesome, and they look good and breathe well enough so I would wear them at times I might not wear traditional hiking boots. They certainly don't FEEL like a boot, more like a high top trail running shoe."

★★★★☆
4/5 stars - Excellent for fast hiking
S
swindyswindyswindy - Reddit Hiking Gear
Andes hiking experience

"They are very comfortable and the waterproofing is great. I got them for hiking around the Andes last month. Con: The tread wasn't good over wet flat rocks and was slippery. I wear them all the time because they are so comfortable and light weight."

★★★★☆
4/5 stars - Great comfort, traction limitations
G
Gryff22 - Amazon Verified Purchase
Durability concerns

"I read on their website that the average mileage for the soles was around 300 miles, and there's nothing on there about how to replace them. Not gonna spend £180 on a pair of boots that will last me a season and end up in landfill."

★★☆☆☆
2/5 stars - Durability concerns

Pros and Cons Analysis

Pros

  • Exceptionally lightweight (410g)
  • Excellent breathability
  • Comfortable sock-like fit
  • Versatile lacing system
  • Great for fast hiking/trail running
  • Responsive CloudTec midsole

Cons

  • Not waterproof
  • Limited durability (300 miles)
  • Poor wet rock traction
  • High price point
  • Upper may tear on sharp rocks
  • Not ideal for heavy backpacking
Shop Women's Version

On Cloudridge vs Competitors Comparison

To provide comprehensive perspective, I've extensively compared the On Cloudridge boots against leading competitors in the lightweight hiking boot category. This analysis draws from months of field testing and detailed examination of technical specifications across multiple brands.

Boot Model Weight Waterproof Price Best For
On Cloudridge 410g No $170 Fast hiking, dry conditions
Merrell Moab Speed 2 490g Yes $180 All-weather versatility
Salomon X Ultra 4 Mid 520g Yes $230 Technical terrain
Columbia Newton Ridge 580g Yes $100 Budget-friendly durability

The weight advantage becomes immediately apparent—the Cloudridge boots are significantly lighter than traditional competitors while maintaining mid-cut ankle support. This 80-110g difference translates to noticeably less fatigue during long hiking days. However, this comes at the cost of waterproofing, which competitors like the Merrell Moab Speed 2 Mid GTX provide.

When comparing traction systems, the Missiongrip outsole performs exceptionally on dry rock and mixed terrain but falls short of the aggressive lugging found on more traditional hiking boots. For those prioritizing maximum grip in varied conditions, the Salomon Contagrip system offers superior all-terrain performance at the expense of added weight.

Price positioning places the Cloudridge in the premium category, reflecting Swiss engineering and innovative materials. The investment makes sense for hikers prioritizing speed and comfort over maximum durability. Budget-conscious hikers might consider Clark shoes for casual hiking or Columbia's offerings for traditional all-weather performance.

Consider Waterproof Alternatives

Sizing Guide and Fit Recommendations

Proper sizing proves critical with On Cloudridge boots due to their unique ripstop upper construction and sock-like fit characteristics. After extensive testing across different foot types and consulting with other hikers, I've developed comprehensive sizing recommendations that account for the boots' specific design elements.

My Sizing Recommendations

  • Standard Fit: Order your normal running shoe size
  • Wide Feet: Consider half-size up for comfort
  • Thick Socks: Half-size up recommended
  • Long Distance: Account for foot swelling with larger size

The ripstop upper material provides more give than traditional leather, allowing the boot to conform to your foot shape over time. This adaptive quality means initial snugness often resolves with wear, but overly tight boots can cause pressure points that won't improve. I found the sweet spot with my normal size 10.5, providing adequate toe room without heel slippage.

Sizing Red Flags

  • Toes touching front of boot
  • Heel slipping when walking
  • Pressure on top of foot
  • Numbness after 30 minutes

Perfect Fit Signs

  • Thumb-width space at toe
  • Secure heel with no movement
  • Even pressure distribution
  • Comfortable after extended wear

The FlexLock lacing system allows fine-tuning of fit zones, compensating for minor sizing variations. I recommend experimenting with different lacing techniques—loose for casual wear, tight for technical terrain. This versatility makes the Cloudridge more forgiving of sizing choices compared to traditional boots with fixed lacing systems.

For reference, my foot measurements are 27cm length, medium width, and I wear size 10.5 in most athletic shoes including Jordan shoes and Travis Scott collaborations. The 10.5 Cloudridge provided perfect fit for day hiking with medium-thickness merino wool socks.

Youth Sizes Available

Frequently Asked Questions

Are On Cloudridge boots waterproof?

No, the On Cloudridge boots are not waterproof. They feature breathable ripstop fabric and 3D mesh lining designed for warm weather hiking and excellent ventilation. The non-waterproof design keeps feet cooler and more comfortable in dry conditions, making them ideal for summer trail adventures and fast-paced hiking where breathability is prioritized over weather protection. For waterproof alternatives, consider checking out waterproof boot options in our gear collection.

How do On Cloudridge boots fit compared to regular running shoes?

On Cloudridge boots generally fit true to size compared to regular running shoes. However, many users recommend going half a size up if you have wider feet or plan to wear thick hiking socks. The ripstop upper provides a sock-like fit that adapts to your foot shape. I found them perfectly sized in my normal running shoe size, with adequate toe room and secure heel fit for technical terrain. The fit is noticeably different from traditional leather boots, offering more flexibility and comfort.

What is the weight of On Cloudridge boots?

The On Cloudridge boots weigh approximately 410g (14.46oz) per shoe for men's UK size 8, making them exceptionally lightweight for a hiking boot. Women's size 5 weighs around 340g per shoe. This ultralight construction, achieved through innovative ripstop fabric and Zero Gravity foam midsole, provides the agility of a trail running shoe with the support of a hiking boot. The weight advantage becomes immediately noticeable during long hiking days, reducing overall leg fatigue significantly.

How durable are On Cloudridge boots for regular hiking?

On Cloudridge boots offer moderate durability with an estimated 300-mile lifespan according to manufacturer specifications. The lightweight ripstop upper excels in comfort but may show wear faster on rocky terrain compared to traditional leather boots. The Missiongrip outsole provides excellent traction initially, though the shallow tread pattern may wear quicker than deeper-lugged competitors. They're best suited for regular day hikes rather than extended backpacking. For comparison, work boots like Brunt offer superior durability for heavy-duty applications.

What terrain are On Cloudridge boots best suited for?

On Cloudridge boots excel on well-maintained trails, rocky singletrack, and moderate terrain in dry conditions. The Missiongrip outsole provides reliable traction on mixed surfaces, while the lightweight design enables fast-paced hiking and trail running. They perform best in warm weather conditions where breathability is crucial. Less ideal for wet conditions, muddy trails, or extended multi-day backpacking where maximum durability is required. The Swiss-engineered design particularly shines on Alpine-style terrain with varied rock surfaces and technical sections.

Can I use On Cloudridge boots for trail running?

Yes, On Cloudridge boots are excellent for trail running and fast hiking. Their lightweight construction, flexible Speedboard technology, and CloudTec midsole provide responsive cushioning perfect for covering ground quickly. The mid-cut design offers ankle support while maintaining the agility needed for technical trail running. Many users specifically choose them as a crossover between trail running shoes and hiking boots for maximum versatility. They're particularly popular among ultralight hikers and those who prefer a more athletic approach to hiking. For dedicated trail running, you might also consider specialized athletic footwear options.

Conclusion

The On Cloudridge boots represent a significant evolution in hiking footwear, successfully bridging the gap between trail running agility and hiking boot support. After extensive testing across diverse terrain and conditions, I can confidently recommend them for hikers prioritizing speed, comfort, and breathability in dry weather conditions.

These boots shine brightest for day hikers, trail runners, and ultralight enthusiasts who value innovation over tradition. The Swiss engineering excellence is evident in every design element, from the precision-crafted Missiongrip outsole to the adaptive ripstop upper. While the premium price point reflects this quality, the performance gains justify the investment for serious hikers.

However, they're not universal solutions. Hikers requiring waterproof protection, maximum durability, or boots for extended backpacking should consider alternatives. The 300-mile durability ceiling and non-waterproof design create specific use cases where other boots might serve better. For comprehensive footwear options, explore our collection including Tecovas boots for style-focused options or Aetrex shoes for specialized comfort features.

Final Recommendation Score: 8.5/10

Exceptional performance for specific use cases, with minor limitations in durability and weather protection.

Men's Cloudridge Women's Alternative

For more hiking gear reviews, trail guides, and outdoor adventure content, visit Explore National Parks Store and join our community of passionate outdoor enthusiasts.
